content:
hl7-fhircast-bot opened Issue #191

## May 2019 Ballot Comment:

Submitted by Anthony Julian
Chapter/section: Subscription Response
Url: https://fhircast.hl7.org/specification/May2019Ballot/index.html
Type: NEG :exclamation: Clarification
In Person requested: Yes :bust_in_silhouette:

Summary:

Comment: See note on ANSI modal verbs.

Existing wording: If the Hub URL supports FHIRcast and is able to handle the subscription or unsubscription request, the Hub MUST respond to a subscription request with an HTTP 202 "Accepted" response to indicate that the request was received and will now be verified by the Hub. The Hub SHOULD perform the verification of intent as soon as possible.
Proposed wording: If the Hub URL supports FHIRcast and is able to handle the subscription or unsubscription request, the Hub SHALL respond to a subscription request with an HTTP 202 "Accepted" response to indicate that the request was received and will now be verified by the Hub. The Hub SHOULD perform the verification of intent as soon as possible.

_This issue was imported by @hl7-fhircast-bot from the consolidated FHIRcast May 2019 ballot spreadsheet._

hl7-fhircast-bot labeled Issue #191

isaacvetter commented on Issue #191

NOTE on ANSI modal verbs: The usage of ANSI modal verbs consistently provides a vehicle for quickly discerning the conformance criteria.
HL7 adheres to ISO/IEC directive, Appendix G: ANSI modal verbs ("SHALL", "SHOULD", "MAY", "SHALL NOT", "SHOULD NOT", "MAY NOT") SHALL be capitalized. See FHIR conformance rules, section 2.1.0.1 "Conformance Language". http://hl7.org/implement/standards/fhir/conformance-rules.html

isaacvetter commented on Issue #191

Use SHALL instead of MUST per HL7 FHIR

wmaethner labeled Issue #191
